description.full:
This object can be supplied when loading a component. It can be either passed as argument for the
`zuix.load(...)` method in the javascript code, or in the `data-ui-options` attribute of the HTML code
of the component container.
description.summary:
This object can be supplied when loading a component. It can be either passed as argument for the
`zuix.load(...)` method in the javascript code, or in the `data-ui-options` attribute of the HTML code
of the component container.

description.full: Callback function triggered if an error occurs when loading a component.
description.summary: Callback function triggered if an error occurs when loading a component.

description.full: Callback function triggered when a component has been successfully loaded.
description.summary: Callback function triggered when a component has been successfully loaded.

tags.string:

If the matching element is just one, then it will also have the extra method `field(fieldName)`
to search for fields contained in it.

to search for fields contained in it.

description.full:
Search the document or inside the given `container` for elements
with `data-ui-field` attribute matching the provided `fieldName`.
This method implements a caching mechanism and automatic
disposal of allocated objects and events.
description.summary:
Search the document or inside the given `container` for elements
with `data-ui-field` attribute matching the provided `fieldName`.
This method implements a caching mechanism and automatic
disposal of allocated objects and events.

tags.string:
<small>**Example - JavaScript**</small>
```js
var exampleController = zuix.controller(function(cp){
    cp.create = function() {
        cp.expose('test', testMethod);
        cp.view().html('Helllo World!');
    }
    function testMethod() {
        console.log("Method exposing test");
        cp.view().html('A simple test.');
    }
});
var componentOptions = {
    container: zuix.field('container-div');
    controller: exampleController,
    ready: function () {
        console.log("Loading complete.");
        console.log("Component instance context", this);
    },
    error: function(error) {
        console.log("Loading error!", error);
    }
};
var ctx = zuix.load('path/to/component_name', componentOptions);
ctx.test();
```
{!string} componentId The identifier name of the component to be loaded.
tags.name: componentId
tags.description: The identifier name of the component to be loaded.

tags.string: {ContextOptions} [options] Options used to initialize the loaded component.
tags.name: [options]
tags.description: Options used to initialize the loaded component.
The component context.

description.full:
Loads a component with the given options.
This is the programmatic equivalent of `data-ui-include`
or `data-ui-load` attributes used to
include content or load components from the HTML code.
description.summary:
Loads a component with the given options.
This is the programmatic equivalent of `data-ui-include`
or `data-ui-load` attributes used to
include content or load components from the HTML code.

tags.string:
{ComponentContext|Element} context The instance of the component to be unloaded or its container element.
Pass *Element* type if the underlying component is lazy-loadable and it might not have been instantiated yet.
tags.name: context
tags.description: The instance of the component to be unloaded or its container element. Pass *Element* type if the underlying component is lazy-loadable and it might not have been instantiated yet.
The ```{Zuix}``` object itself.

description.full: Unloads the given component context releasing all allocated resources.
description.summary: Unloads the given component context releasing all allocated resources.

tags.string:
**Example - JavaScript** 

 // Allocates the controller handler to be used for the component 'path/to/component_name'
 var ctrl = zuix.controller(function(cp) {
    // `cp` is the {ContextController}
    cp.create = function() { ... };
    cp.destroy = function() { ... }
}).for('path/to/component_name');
{ContextControllerHandler} handler Function called to initialize the component controller that will be passed as argument of this function.
tags.name: handler
tags.description: Function called to initialize the component controller that will be passed as argument of this function.
The allocated controller handler.

description.full:
Allocates the handler for the component controller. The provided `handler` function will be called
to initialize the controller object once the component has been loaded.
description.summary:
Allocates the handler for the component controller. The provided `handler` function will be called
to initialize the controller object once the component has been loaded.

tags.string:
**Example - HTML** ```html
...
``` **Example - JavaScript** ```js var slideShowDiv = zuix.$.find('[data-ui-context="my-slide-show"]'); var ctx = zuix.context(slideShowDiv); // or var ctx = zuix.context('my-slide-show'); // call exposed component methods ctx.setSlide(1); // or var ctx; zuix.context('my-slide-show', function(c) { // call component methods c.setSlide(1); // eventually store a reference to the component for later use ctx = c; }); ```

{Element|ZxQuery|object} contextId The `contextId` object
(usually a string) or the container/view element of the component.
tags.name: contextId
tags.description: The `contextId` object (usually a string) or the container/view element of the component.

tags.string: {function} [callback] The callback function that will be called once the component is loaded. The {ComponentContext} object will be passed as argument of this callback.
tags.name: [callback]
tags.description: The callback function that will be called once the component is loaded. The {ComponentContext} object will be passed as argument of this callback.

tags.string: {ComponentContext} The matching component context or `null` if the component does not exists or it is not yet loaded.
tags.description: The matching component context or `null` if the component does not exists or it is not yet loaded.

description.full:
Gets a `ComponentContext` object, given its `contextId` or its container/view element.
The `contextId` is the one specified by the `ContextOptions` object or by using the HTML attribute `data-ui-context`.
description.summary:
Gets a `ComponentContext` object, given its `contextId` or its container/view element.
The `contextId` is the one specified by the `ContextOptions` object or by using the HTML attribute `data-ui-context`.

tags.string: {string} componentId Identifier name of the component to create.
tags.name: componentId
tags.description: Identifier name of the component to create.

tags.name: [options]
tags.description: Component context options.

description.full:
Creates the component specified by `componentId` and returns its `{ComponentContext}` object.
The returned component it's unloaded and detached from the DOM and it must be explicitly attached.
After attaching it to the DOM, `zuix.componentize()` must be called in
order to actually load and display the component.
description.summary:
Creates the component specified by `componentId` and returns its `{ComponentContext}` object.
The returned component it's unloaded and detached from the DOM and it must be explicitly attached.
After attaching it to the DOM, `zuix.componentize()` must be called in
order to actually load and display the component.

tags.string: {Object} context The context object (`this`) passed to handler functions listening to this event.
tags.name: context
tags.description: The context object (`this`) passed to handler functions listening to this event.

tags.string: {string} eventPath The path of the event to fire.
tags.name: eventPath
tags.description: The path of the event to fire.

tags.string: {object} [eventData] The data object of the event.
tags.name: [eventData]
tags.description: The data object of the event.
The ```{Zuix}``` object itself.

description.full: Triggers the event specified by `eventPath`.
description.summary: Triggers the event specified by `eventPath`.

tags.string:
<small>**Example - JavaScript**</small>
```js
// The context `this` in the event handlers will be
// the {ComponentContext} object that sourced the event.
// The `data` parameter passed to the handlers, is of
// variant type, depending on the type of the occurring event.
zuix
  .hook('load:begin', function(data){
    loaderMessage.html('Loading "'+data.task+'" ...');
    loaderMessage.show();

}).hook('load:next', function(data){
    loaderMessage.html('"'+data.task+'" done, loading next..');

}).hook('load:end', function(){
    loaderMessage.hide();

}).hook('html:parse', function (data) {
    // ShowDown - MarkDown syntax compiler
    if (this.options().markdown === true && typeof showdown !== 'undefined')
        data.content = new showdown.Converter()
            .makeHtml(data.content);

}).hook('css:parse', function (data) {
    // process css, eg. run a CSS pre-processor
    // eg. Sass, Less, ...

}).hook('view:process', function (view) {
    // The view DOM is now fully loaded and ready

    // Prism code syntax highlighter
    view.find('code').each(function (i, block) {
        this.addClass('language-javascript');
        Prism.highlightElement(block);
    });

    // Force opening of all non-local links in a new window
    zuix.$('a[href*="://"]').attr('target','_blank');

    // Material Design Light auto-detection
    // Call DOM upgrade on newly added view elements
    if (componentHandler)
        componentHandler.upgradeElements(view.get());

});
```

tags.name: eventPath
tags.description: The event path.

tags.name: eventHandler
tags.description: The handler function.
The ```{Zuix}``` object itself.

description.full:
Registers a callback for a global ZUIX event.
There can only be one callback for each kind of global hook event.
Pass null as <eventHandler> to stop listening to a previously registered callback.
description.summary:
Registers a callback for a global ZUIX event.
There can only be one callback for each kind of global hook event.
Pass null as <eventHandler> to stop listening to a previously registered callback.

tags.string:
**Example - JavaScript** 

 // Controller of component 'path/to/component_name'
 zuix.controller(function(cp) {
    cp.init = function() {
        zuix.using('script', 'https://some.cdn.js/moment.min.js', function(){
            // can start using moment.js
        });
    };
    cp.create = function() { ... };
    cp.destroy = function() { ... }
});

tags.name: resourceType
tags.description: Either `style`, `script` or `component`.

tags.string: {string} resourcePath Relative or absolute resource url path
tags.name: resourcePath
tags.description: Relative or absolute resource url path

tags.string: {function} [callback] Callback function to call once resource is loaded.
tags.name: [callback]
tags.description: Callback function to call once resource is loaded.

description.full:
Loads a CSS or Javascript resource. All CSS styles and Javascript scripts
loaded with this method will be also included in the application bundle.
If a resource is already loaded, the request will be ignored.
This command is also meant to be used inside a components' controller.
This enables the loading of a component without the need of manually including
all of its dependencies since those will be automatically fetched as required.
description.summary:
Loads a CSS or Javascript resource. All CSS styles and Javascript scripts
loaded with this method will be also included in the application bundle.
If a resource is already loaded, the request will be ignored.
This command is also meant to be used inside a components' controller.
This enables the loading of a component without the need of manually including
all of its dependencies since those will be automatically fetched as required.

tags.name: [enable]
tags.description: Enable or disable lazy loading.

tags.string: {number} [threshold] Load-ahead threshold (default is 1.0 => 100% of view size).
tags.name: [threshold]
tags.description: Load-ahead threshold (default is 1.0 => 100% of view size).
*true* if lazy-loading is enabled, *false* otherwise.

description.full: Enables/Disables lazy-loading or gets the current setting.
description.summary: Enables/Disables lazy-loading or gets the current setting.

tags.string: {Zuix|boolean} *true* if HTTP caching is enabled, *false* otherwise.
tags.description: *true* if HTTP caching is enabled, *false* otherwise.

description.full: Enables/Disables HTTP caching or gets the current settings.
description.summary: Enables/Disables HTTP caching or gets the current settings.

tags.string: {Element|ZxQuery} [element] Container to use as starting node for the search (**default:** *document*).
tags.name: [element]
tags.description: Container to use as starting node for the search (**default:** *document*).
The ```{Zuix}``` object itself.

description.full:
Searches the document, or inside the given ```element```,
for all ```data-ui-include``` and ```data-ui-load``` attributes
and processes these by loading the requested components.
This is a service function that should only be called if dynamically
adding content with elements that contain *load* or *include* directives.
description.summary:
Searches the document, or inside the given ```element```,
for all ```data-ui-include``` and ```data-ui-load``` attributes
and processes these by loading the requested components.
This is a service function that should only be called if dynamically
adding content with elements that contain *load* or *include* directives.
